e4: The new policy, while potentially more truthful and equitable may be slightly harder in the short term which justifies consideration at minimal financial cost.
e5: I view an ethical reporting policy as transparency, honesty, and consistency in presenting numbers. The new policy's commitment to truthfulness and accuracy is ethical. Equitable treatment of investors without regard for level complexity and financial education should also be considered an important factor, such that policies must accommodate, at minimal cost, a full population when reasonable to do so.
e6: What if our competitor changes their reporting policy to unbiased earnings and we don't? Would investors see our delayed change in policy and loss of transparency as a disadvantage? We should evaluate whether retaining the status quo while others move towards greater clarity could put us at a competitive disadvantage.
